Instruction:
Task Description: The task involves creating a Java class that utilizes ProcessBuilder to execute external processes, specifically for performance monitoring and data collection using the 'perf' tool. The class should handle process execution, stream management, and synchronization.

Class Description: This class is designed to interact with the Linux 'perf' performance monitoring tool. It provides functionality to parse performance events and add JVM invocation options for performance recording. The class manages process execution, handles input/output streams, and ensures proper synchronization.

Attributes:
- sampleFrequency: [String] - The sampling frequency for performance recording
- optFrequency: [OptionSpec<String>] - Configuration option for frequency setting
- perfBinData: [File] - File object storing binary performance data (implied from context)
- perfParsedData: [File] - File object for storing parsed performance data (implied from context)
- requestedEventNames: [Collection<String>] - Collection of performance event names to monitor (implied from context)

Methods:
- parseEvents() -> [void] - Executes the 'perf script' command to parse binary performance data, redirects process output streams to a file, and waits for process completion
- addJVMInvokeOptions(BenchmarkParams params) -> [Collection<String>] - Generates command-line options for 'perf record' with specified sampling frequency and events
- InputStreamDrainer(InputStream, OutputStream) -> [void] - Helper class/thread for draining process streams (implied from context)
